title: Cloud Mages' Chambers
data:
***Version [0.22](/0.22 "0.22")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                                      |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Perhaps it is the humidity, or the constant flow of clouds, but the floor here remains forever damp. |

The **Cloud Mage's Chambers** is a [Wizard Laboratory](/Wizard_Laboratory "Wizard Laboratory") made of white crystal (functionally identical to the crystal [walls](/Wall "Wall") found elsewhere) and dedicated to control over air and [clouds](/Cloud "Cloud"). It has a fairly straightforward layout, with two small treasure chambers in the lower half of the map and a boss chamber at the top. Along the way, clouds of "white fluffiness" will hamper your [LOS](/LOS "LOS") as air-, lightning-, and cloud-themed foes attack.

There are multiple types of threat here, but [electricity](/Electricity "Electricity") damage is the most common, so rElec is very helpful in clearing the chambers. [Negative energy](/Negative_energy "Negative energy") resistance and [cold](/Cold "Cold") resistance can also be helpful for some of the other threats. If you're fortunate enough to come here while worshiping [Qazlal](/Qazlal "Qazlal") or carrying a [scarf](/Scarf "Scarf") of [cloud immunity](/Cloud_immunity "Cloud immunity"), you'll have significantly less to worry about from many monsters here. Fortunately, there's a better-than-even chance you'll find such a scarf or [potions of resistance](/Potions_of_resistance "Potions of resistance") in the smaller treasure chambers, letting even under-equipped explorers stand a chance.

Ranged weapon specialists may want to ensure they have a decent backup melee weapon, as some of the creatures here are exceedingly difficult to hit with ranged attacks.

The treasure in the bottom two chambers will be mostly [potions](/Potions "Potions") and [scrolls](/Scrolls "Scrolls") ([potions of resistance](/Potions_of_resistance "Potions of resistance") and [scrolls of fog](/Scrolls_of_fog "Scrolls of fog") and [silence](/Scroll_of_silence "Scroll of silence") are common), though rarer items like a [fan of gales](/Fan_of_gales "Fan of gales") or scarf of cloud immunity can appear. The boss chamber contains [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic")-themed items ([spell books](/Spell_book "Spell book") and [staves](/Staff_of_air "Staff of air")), good [rings](/Ring "Ring") (such as [flight](/Ring_of_flight "Ring of flight") or [evasion](/Ring_of_evasion "Ring of evasion")), and [boots](/Boots "Boots") of [running](/Running "Running") or [flying](/Flight_\(ego\) "Flight (ego)"). This lab also has a good chance of producing a [quick blade](/Quick_blade "Quick blade"), either as a weapon for the Cloud Mage or as loot in their chamber.

## Contents

- [1 Monsters](#Monsters)
  - [1.1 Boss: Cloud Mage](#Boss:_Cloud_Mage)
- [2 Source](#Source)
- [3 History](#History)

## Monsters

E [![Air elemental.png](/images/0/06/Air_elemental.png)](/File:Air_elemental.png) **[Air elemental](/Air_elemental "Air elemental")**- Moderate melee attackers that have high speed, [EV](/EV "EV"), and the [ability](/Vortex "Vortex") to create short-lived mini-tornadoes around themselves.

S [![Shock serpent.png](/images/8/81/Shock_serpent.png)](/File:Shock_serpent.png) **[Shock serpent](/Shock_serpent "Shock serpent")**- Electric snakes that fire off [bolts of electricity](/Electrical_Bolt "Electrical Bolt") and counterattack with more electricity when injured.

y [![Spark wasp.png](/images/0/07/Spark_wasp.png)](/File:Spark_wasp.png) **[Spark wasp](/Spark_wasp "Spark wasp")**- Wasps that also specialize in electricity; they don't counterattack, but can [launch themselves](/Blinkbolt "Blinkbolt") as bolts of lightning.

k [![Wind drake.png](/images/b/b7/Wind_drake.png)](/File:Wind_drake.png) **[Wind drake](/Wind_drake "Wind drake")**- Weak in melee, [deflects ranged attacks](/Repel_Missiles "Repel Missiles") and is able to cast [Airstrike](/Airstrike "Airstrike") and push you backwards.

k [![Death drake.png](/images/a/a6/Death_drake.png)](/File:Death_drake.png) **[Death drake](/Death_drake "Death drake")**- Also fairly weak, but able to breathe clouds of devastating [miasma](/Miasma "Miasma").

t [![Ghost crab.png](/images/1/1a/Ghost_crab.png)](/File:Ghost_crab.png) **[Ghost crab](/Ghost_crab "Ghost crab")**- Scuttling menaces that spew vast banks of spectral mist, [draining](/Drain "Drain") your life force and summoning [spectral](/Spectral_thing "Spectral thing") reinforcements.

t [![Apocalypse crab.png](/images/8/88/Apocalypse_crab.png)](/File:Apocalypse_crab.png) **[Apocalypse crab](/Apocalypse_crab "Apocalypse crab")**- Dangerous crustaceans that breathe clouds of pure [chaos](/Chaos "Chaos").

2 [![Blizzard demon.png](/images/2/25/Blizzard_demon.png)](/File:Blizzard_demon.png) **[Blizzard demon](/Blizzard_demon "Blizzard demon")**- Demons of ice and storm capable of hitting you with significant [cold](/Cold "Cold") and [electricity](/Electricity "Electricity") damage in addition to [Airstrike](/Airstrike "Airstrike").

i [![Spriggan air mage.png](/images/c/cd/Spriggan_air_mage.png)](/File:Spriggan_air_mage.png) **[Spriggan air mage](/Spriggan_air_mage "Spriggan air mage")**- Diminutive wizards who can control the placement of clouds as well as just pelting you with lightning and Airstrike.

v [![Twister.png](/images/c/c2/Twister.png)](/File:Twister.png) **[Twister](/Twister "Twister")**- These can be found outside the walls of the Wizard Laboratory and basically serve as decoration for the vault. Do not smash open these walls, as the near-invulnerability of twisters and their constant [Tornado](/Tornado "Tornado") effect will swiftly result in a miserable swirling death.

### Boss: Cloud Mage

In the center of the top chamber is a randomly named **Cloud Mage**. Isolating them from their allies before the fight is recommended. If you can get them into melee, they'll often resort to their pathetic melee skills instead of hammering you with wind magic, though getting in close makes [Tornado](/Tornado "Tornado") more dangerous. Alternatively, any decent offensive caster should be able to obliterate them in fairly short order.

|   |                                                                                                    |
| - | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A strange wizard who has attained mastery over clouds, making deft and foreboding mystic gestures. |

  


@ [![Cloud Mage.png](/images/2/2a/Cloud_Mage.png)](/File:Cloud_Mage.png)  
**[HP](/HP "HP")**: 150  
**[HD](/HD "HD")**: 20  
**Spells**: [Airstrike](/Airstrike "Airstrike"), [Tornado](/Tornado "Tornado")  
**Equipment**: [Quick blade](/Quick_blade "Quick blade")/[dagger](/Dagger "Dagger") of [electrocution](/Electrocution "Electrocution") or a [staff of air](/Staff_of_air "Staff of air"), [robe](/Robe "Robe") (always the [Robe of Clouds](/Robe_of_Clouds "Robe of Clouds") if it hasn't already generated elsewhere)  
**Recommendations**: Much like the rest of the lab, stay on the ground. Of course, you don't have a choice in the matter if you get caught in a Tornado. [Silence](/Silence "Silence") works well to shut them down if necessary.

## History

- [0.22](/0.22 "0.22") removed [fire crabs](/Fire_crab "Fire crab") from the lab.
- [0.21](/0.21 "0.21") revamped the lab to make it significantly more challenging, adding fire, ghost, and apocalypse crabs, shock serpents, spark wasps, blizzard demons, and death drakes as well as removing insubstantial wisps. Additionally, the Cloud Mage could have a [freezing](/Freezing "Freezing")-branded short blade instead of a staff of air.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), this Wizlab had [vapours](/Vapour "Vapour") instead of wind drakes making it more dangerous for those without electricity resistance.

Cloud Mages' Chambers

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.22: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Perhaps it is the humidity, or the constant flow of clouds, but the floor here remains forever damp.

The Cloud Mage's Chambers is a Wizard Laboratory made of white crystal (functionally identical to the crystal walls found elsewhere) and dedicated to control over air and clouds. It has a fairly straightforward layout, with two small treasure chambers in the lower half of the map and a boss chamber at the top. Along the way, clouds of "white fluffiness" will hamper your LOS as air-, lightning-, and cloud-themed foes attack.

There are multiple types of threat here, but electricity damage is the most common, so rElec is very helpful in clearing the chambers. Negative energy resistance and cold resistance can also be helpful for some of the other threats. If you're fortunate enough to come here while worshiping Qazlal or carrying a scarf of cloud immunity, you'll have significantly less to worry about from many monsters here. Fortunately, there's a better-than-even chance you'll find such a scarf or potions of resistance in the smaller treasure chambers, letting even under-equipped explorers stand a chance.

Ranged weapon specialists may want to ensure they have a decent backup melee weapon, as some of the creatures here are exceedingly difficult to hit with ranged attacks.

The treasure in the bottom two chambers will be mostly potions and scrolls (potions of resistance and scrolls of fog and silence are common), though rarer items like a fan of gales or scarf of cloud immunity can appear. The boss chamber contains Air Magic-themed items (spell books and staves), good rings (such as flight or evasion), and boots of running or flying. This lab also has a good chance of producing a quick blade, either as a weapon for the Cloud Mage or as loot in their chamber.

Contents

  • 2 Source

Monsters

E Air elemental- Moderate melee attackers that have high speed, EV, and the ability to create short-lived mini-tornadoes around themselves.

S Shock serpent- Electric snakes that fire off bolts of electricity and counterattack with more electricity when injured.

y Spark wasp- Wasps that also specialize in electricity; they don't counterattack, but can launch themselves as bolts of lightning.

k Wind drake- Weak in melee, deflects ranged attacks and is able to cast Airstrike and push you backwards.

k Death drake- Also fairly weak, but able to breathe clouds of devastating miasma.

t Ghost crab- Scuttling menaces that spew vast banks of spectral mist, draining your life force and summoning spectral reinforcements.

t Apocalypse crab- Dangerous crustaceans that breathe clouds of pure chaos.

2 Blizzard demon- Demons of ice and storm capable of hitting you with significant cold and electricity damage in addition to Airstrike.

i Spriggan air mage- Diminutive wizards who can control the placement of clouds as well as just pelting you with lightning and Airstrike.

v Twister- These can be found outside the walls of the Wizard Laboratory and basically serve as decoration for the vault. Do not smash open these walls, as the near-invulnerability of twisters and their constant Tornado effect will swiftly result in a miserable swirling death.

Boss: Cloud Mage

In the center of the top chamber is a randomly named Cloud Mage. Isolating them from their allies before the fight is recommended. If you can get them into melee, they'll often resort to their pathetic melee skills instead of hammering you with wind magic, though getting in close makes Tornado more dangerous. Alternatively, any decent offensive caster should be able to obliterate them in fairly short order.

A strange wizard who has attained mastery over clouds, making deft and foreboding mystic gestures.

@
HP: 150
HD: 20
Spells: Airstrike, Tornado
Equipment: Quick blade/dagger of electrocution or a staff of air, robe (always the Robe of Clouds if it hasn't already generated elsewhere)
Recommendations: Much like the rest of the lab, stay on the ground. Of course, you don't have a choice in the matter if you get caught in a Tornado. Silence works well to shut them down if necessary.
